children.subject: If you're a sophomore right now, you definitely have lots and lots of time to take 162 in the future. I get wanting to take it by recruiting szn but honestly I don't think just listing the class makes that much of a difference. Put it another way, if you take it spring of junior year youll have acquired the knowledge by jr year internship.
I think familiarity with C, learning how to use gdb are very important skills used in 162 and built in 61c. Content wise, caches, virtual memory are relevant.
@11006 actually has a better list of topics!

But yeah, definitely do not do this!!! I took 162 this semester (having taken 61c 2 semesters prior) and definitely had to put in a ton of work. Both 61c and 162 are extremely high workload and especially if you are lacking the fundamentals from 61c, 162 is gonna be a nightmare, not to mention it mught be tough finding a solid project group if you're taking 61c concurrently. Don't do it!!!!!
+1 would not recommend this, you're not at a disadvantage in terms of recruiting if you delay 162 until spring senior year

Something you can try maybe is watching the first week of lectures and doing the first homework assignment for 162. I definitely think the class is worth taking, but it moves by extremely quickly. The first hw covers c fundamentals, so I think it would give a good taste of prerequisite knowledge is needed for 162
Definitely DO NOT DO THIS!!!!! Definitely a horrible idea!!

history.content:
Please don’t do this. Or if you do decide to, just know that if hw0 is difficult or takes more than 15 hours it will not get easier for you and will only get a lot harder. Your group members will also dislike you if you can’t carry your own weight in the projects and your grade will reflect that. 

There are certainly a group of students that do take 162 and 61c concurrently and you can absolutely thrive that way, but generally you should already know that you’re prepared. I think typically you should’ve already thought a lot about questions like “what happens when a computer turns on?” And “how exactly does hardware and execute a program?” 

-a 162 ta

children.subject: Sorry, I hate to be the one to discourage people from being ambitious, but I also think that people put too much stress on themselves, thinking they’re obligated to do things that there’s no need to do
no, I sincerely thank you for the advice! I don't really know what I'm doing while planning courses so really happy that I have people to talk to.
OP here, haha thank you so much for the advice, I definitely will not be doing this :^)

186, 168, and 161 are all much gentler systems classes. 161 is arguably the most useful and IMO you will appreciate 168 more after taking 162, but I wouldn’t worry too much about it. 

Presumably you’re going into your sophomore internship. I would honestly just focus on learning/understanding the other side of SWE that isn’t taught in school. Sophomore summer is probably the best time to just learn and try to soak in information. It’ll probably be your first exposure to a CI/CD system, real testing frameworks and systems, and a professionally maintained development environment.
thank you alexander! do you not need 61c for 168/161?

Oh whoops yeah actually that totally slipped my mind, you definitely need 61c for 161, I’m inclined to say it isn’t as important for 168 or 186 though since neither really deals with the nitty gritty details of machine structures
great, thanks so much for your help :)

followup question if anyone sees: what would be a good class to take in terms of industry then? I will have taken 61a/b/70/170 and currently just 61c in my first semester junior year. I was thinking 186 but wondering if anyone else has any other ideas

history.content:
(note: searched piazza already and see mixed reviews, most pointing to the fact that 162 is reliant on 61c stuff, but wanted to ask here again to see what the consensus is if I am willing to try and prep 61c material before taking these two classes together.)

I've heard you should have 61c done before taking anything in the 160 series, but I know 162 is a really important class for a CS career including internships and after sitting for an hour and planning my schedule, I'm struggling to fit it in by recruiting season for my junior year. I am currently planning 61c for fall semester junior year (can't take it before then), but I'd like to do 162 then too. 

I'm wondering how good/bad of an idea it is to do them concurrently, and if anyone has done something similar before? What if I try to prep some of the 61c knowledge that is used in 162 over the summer? I am currently a sophomore and will be doing an internship over the summer but am otherwise free, so I'm tryna know if I can make this work if I prep some of the material beforehand. For reference I have absolutely no prior knowledge in anything 61c related, and I am planning on taking no other techs with 61c/162 if I do so. What specific topics would I have to prepare if I go this route?

thanks for the help!
history.subject: 162 and 61c concurrently?
